p: On the other hand, as mentioned previously, bibliographic research highlights a low number of in vivo experiments made on the use of EOs in treating mastitis: Abboud et al. studied the effect of 10% of a mixture of Thymus vulgaris and Lavandula angustifolia, by intramammary infusion and external application on the quarter. After four days of treatment, they discovered a substantial decrease in the bacterial colony count. The most potent antibacterial activity was achieved by massaging the udder with the mixture of EOs [ 152].
